message.content:
Research Code Quality automation for duplication detection, API validation, documentation, and architecture consistency.

Find:
1. Code duplication detection (jscpd, PMD CPD, simian)
2. API contract validation (OpenAPI, Pact, contract testing)
3. Documentation completeness checks (docstrings, comments, READMEs)
4. Architectural consistency validation (dependency rules, layering)

Look for:
- Tools that integrate with git hooks
- Automated quality gates
- Actionable reports and fix suggestions
- Examples from linting frameworks
- Architecture decision records (ADR) validation

Focus on lightweight tools that can run automatically and provide clear recommendations.

Thoroughness: medium

content.text: I'll research code quality automation tools for duplication detection, API validation, documentation, and architecture consistency. Let me search for this information across multiple sources in parallel.

input.query: code duplication detection tools jscpd PMD CPD simian 2025
API contract validation testing OpenAPI Pact 2025
documentation completeness automation docstring validation tools
architectural consistency validation dependency rules layering tools

Web search results for query: "documentation completeness automation docstring validation tools"

Links: [{"title":"Automated Code Documentation","url":"https://www.createq.com/en/software-engineering-hub/automated-code-documentation"},{"title":"AI for code documentation: automating comments and docs","url":"https://graphite.com/guides/ai-code-documentation-automation"},{"title":"DocAgent: A Multi-Agent System for Automated Code Documentation Generation","url":"https://arxiv.org/html/2504.08725v1"},{"title":"Auto Document Your Code: Tools & Best Practices Guide 2025 - Augment Code","url":"https://www.augmentcode.com/learn/auto-document-your-code-tools-and-best-practices"},{"title":"Document Validation: Ensure document integrity with advanced validation | Adlib","url":"https://www.adlibsoftware.com/document-automation-software/document-validation"},{"title":"GitHub - PyCQA/pydocstyle: docstring style checker","url":"https://github.com/PyCQA/pydocstyle"},{"title":"doctest — Test interactive Python examples — Python 3.14.2 documentation","url":"https://docs.python.org/3/library/doctest.html"},{"title":"DocumentationTools - Python Wiki","url":"https://wiki.python.org/moin/DocumentationTools"},{"title":"Automatic documentation generation from code — Sphinx documentation","url":"https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/tutorial/automatic-doc-generation.html"},{"title":"Best Practices for Learning Automated Docstring Generation","url":"https://zencoder.ai/blog/learn-automated-docstring-techniques"}]

I found relevant search results about documentation completeness automation and docstring validation tools. Here's what the search reveals:

## Key Tools and Approaches

### Docstring Validation Tools

**pydocstyle** is a static analysis tool for checking compliance with Python docstring conventions and supports most of PEP 257. This tool checks docstrings for compliance with Python docstring conventions, ensuring quality in Python docstring automation efforts.

### Automated Documentation Generation

AI-powered analysis tools understand code semantics and generate meaningful docstrings, comments, and API documentation automatically, with automated documentation pipelines that update technical specifications when code changes are committed.

Several modern platforms are available: AI-powered platforms like Swimm, Theneo, Apidog, and DocuWriter.ai generate contextual documentation from existing code patterns by analyzing function signatures, variable names, and code structure.

### Completeness Assessment

To quantify completeness, automated checkers use Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) analysis and regular expressions, identifying code components like classes, functions, and methods and extracting their generated docstrings.

### Traditional Generation Tools

Doxygen supports multiple languages including C++, C, Python, Java, PHP, C#, Objective-C, IDL, and Fortran, and Sphinx, while primarily a documentation generator, can help create docstring templates.

### Quality Framework

A robust evaluation framework assesses Completeness, Helpfulness, and Truthfulness, with advanced systems producing more complete, helpful, and factually accurate documentation.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.content:
Web search results for query: "code duplication detection tools jscpd PMD CPD simian 2025"

Links: [{"title":"5 Best Duplicate Code Checker Tools for Dev Teams (2025)","url":"https://www.codeant.ai/blogs/best-duplicate-code-checker-tools"},{"title":"GitLab Code Quality Duplication Analysis With PMD CPD","url":"https://aarongoldenthal.com/posts/gitlab-code-quality-duplication-analysis-with-pmd-cpd/"},{"title":"Code Duplication Detection Tools - Software Engineering Handbook","url":"https://software-engineering-handbook.com/Guides/Static Analysis/Code Duplication Detection Tools"},{"title":"Finding duplicated code with CPD | PMD Source Code Analyzer","url":"https://pmd.github.io/pmd/pmd_userdocs_cpd.html"},{"title":"jscpd - npm","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/jscpd"},{"title":"GitHub - kucherenko/jscpd: Copy/paste detector for programming source code.","url":"https://github.com/kucherenko/jscpd"},{"title":"Automate Away Duplicate Code: A Practical Guide - Augment Code","url":"https://www.augmentcode.com/guides/automate-away-duplicate-code-a-practical-guide"},{"title":"GitHub - pmd/pmd: An extensible multilanguage static code analyzer.","url":"https://github.com/pmd/pmd"},{"title":"Duplicated code detector (jscpd) - Visual Studio Marketplace","url":"https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ctf0.duplicated-code-new"},{"title":"Duplicate Code Detection with PMD CPD - Coveros","url":"https://www.coveros.com/duplicate-code-detection-with-pmd-cpd/"}]

Based on the search results, here's an overview of these code duplication detection tools:

## Tool Capabilities

**JSCPD**
JSCPD gives the ability to find duplicated blocks implemented on more than 150 programming languages and digital formats of documents.(no content)The jscpd tool implements Rabin-Karp algorithm for searching duplications.(no content)JSCPD seems to be a better tool to start with, having support for 150+ programming languages and various command line options.

**PMD CPD**
PMD is primarily a static analysis tool for Java and Apex (and is itself a Java-based tool), although provides some support for 16 other languages.(no content)PMD CPD supports 31 languages.(no content)Both of these tools use variations of the Rabin-Karp algorithm for detecting duplicate code.

**Simian**
Simian supports Java, C#, C, C++, Ruby, Objective-C, Groovy, Swift and is available as IntelliJ plugin.

## Comparison

Both PMD CPD and jscpd are capable and produced similar results, with PMD CPD producing more comprehensive results.(no content)By design, jscpd only compares two sections of code, so for cases of 3 or more duplications they're reported in pairs.

## Practical Use

jscpd is used as a backup for languages SonarQube doesn't handle in production setups.(no content)PMD CPD is faster for Java-focused shops.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: "API contract validation testing OpenAPI Pact 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Introduction | Pact Docs","url":"https://docs.pact.io/"},{"title":"OpenAPI Specification Contracts | PactFlow Documentation","url":"https://docs.pactflow.io/docs/bi-directional-contract-testing/contracts/oas/"},{"title":"Convince me | Pact Docs","url":"https://docs.pact.io/faq/convinceme"},{"title":"Pact Open Source Update — May 2025 | Pact Docs","url":"https://docs.pact.io/blog/2025/05/28/pact-open-source-update-may-2025"},{"title":"Pact vs OpenAPI: Choosing the right foundation for your API testing strategy | Speakeasy","url":"https://www.speakeasy.com/blog/pact-vs-openapi"},{"title":"Contract Testing with OpenAPI. Wait, is that really possible? | by Beppe Catanese | Geek Culture | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/geekculture/contract-testing-with-openapi-42267098ddc7"},{"title":"Using Pactflow for Schema-Based Contract Testing | Pactflow","url":"https://pactflow.io/blog/contract-testing-using-json-schemas-and-open-api-part-3/"},{"title":"Enforcing API Correctness: Automated Contract Testing with OpenAPI and Dredd - DEV Community","url":"https://dev.to/r3d_cr0wn/enforcing-api-correctness-automated-contract-testing-with-openapi-and-dredd-2212"},{"title":"Tools for API Testing in 2025","url":"https://redocly.com/learn/testing/tools-for-api-testing-in-2025"},{"title":"Protecting your API development workflows with Swagger/OpenAPI & Pact.io | by YOU54F | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@you54f/protecting-your-api-development-workflows-with-swagger-openapi-pact-io-5ba8dca8b9cf"}]

Here are the search results for API contract validation testing with OpenAPI and Pact in 2025:

## Contract Testing Overview

Contract testing is a technique for ensuring a provider's actual behaviour conforms to its documented contract, for example, an OpenAPI document.(no content)Pact is a code-first tool for testing HTTP and message integrations using contract tests.

## OpenAPI and Pact in 2025

Recent developments show significant evolution in this space:

- PactFlow AI includes features to improve contract testing efficiency and quality, including generating Pact tests using various combinations of OpenAPI descriptions, code, or request-response pairs.

- Dredd validates against live OpenAPI specs by sending actual HTTP requests to enforce schema compliance, status codes, and response payloads, transforming static documentation into a dynamic enforcement mechanism.

## Integration of OpenAPI and Pact

Using OpenAPI in combination with Pact gives you confidence your API meets any published specification (for external clients), whilst giving you the confidence that any known consumer requirements (internal) are satisfied.

However, the OpenAPI standard does not yet establish a unique relation between a request and its response, which prevents spec designers from defining interaction flows that are the essence of contract testing.

## Consumer-Driven Contract Testing

Pact is a common tool for consumer-driven contract testing where consumer-side tests generate a contract file that is published to a central Pact Broker, and the provider's CI pipeline fetches these contracts from the broker and verifies them against the provider codebase.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Layered Architecture & Dependency Injection: A Recipe for Clean and Testable FastAPI Code - DEV Community","url":"https://dev.to/markoulis/layered-architecture-dependency-injection-a-recipe-for-clean-and-testable-fastapi-code-3ioo"},{"title":"Live Dependency Validation in Visual Studio 2019 | Azure DevOps Hands-on-Labs","url":"https://azuredevopslabs.com/labs/devopsserver/livedependencyvalidation/"},{"title":"Add custom architecture validation to dependency diagrams | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/modeling/add-custom-architecture-validation-to-layer-diagrams?view=vs-2022"},{"title":"Live architecture dependency validation in Visual Studio “15” Preview 5 - Azure DevOps Blog","url":"https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/live-architecture-dependency-validation-in-visual-studio-15-preview-5/"},{"title":"Clean Architecture with Dependency Rule | by Mehmet Ozkaya | Design Microservices Architecture with Patterns & Principles | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/design-microservices-architecture-with-patterns/clean-architecture-with-dependency-rule-dff96d479a60"},{"title":"Architecture validation as an integral part of the software development process | by iteo | Medium","url":"https://iteo.medium.com/architecture-validation-as-an-integral-part-of-the-software-development-process-7ab4e8bb8760"},{"title":"Using dependency models to manage software architecture","url":"https://www.researchgate.net/publication/238939814_Using_dependency_models_to_manage_software_architecture"},{"title":"Clean Architecture: The essence of the dependency rule | by Nicholas Ocket | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@aboutcoding/clean-architecture-the-essence-of-the-dependency-rule-969f1e8417f6"},{"title":"The Clean Architecture Dependency Rule | The Dependency Rule | InformIT","url":"https://www.informit.com/articles/article.aspx?p=2832399"},{"title":"Layered Architecture, Dependency Injection, and Dependency Inversion","url":"https://www.codemag.com/article/0705071/Layered-Architecture-Dependency-Injection-and-Dependency-Inversion"}]

Based on the web search results, here's comprehensive information about architectural consistency validation, dependency rules, layering, and related tools:

## Core Concepts

**Architectural Validation and Dependency Rules**

Visual Studio 2019 enables teams to validate architectural dependencies in their solutions using the Layer Designer, which helps ensure that developers respect the architectural constraints of the application as they edit their code.(no content)"Layer" diagrams have been renamed "dependency validation" diagrams to make it clearer what they are for.(no content)In Visual Studio, users can validate the source code in a project against a layer model to verify that the source code conforms to the dependencies on a dependency diagram, with both a standard validation algorithm and custom validation extensions available.

**The Dependency Rule in Clean Architecture**

The Dependency Rule says that the dependencies of a source code can only point inwards, meaning code dependencies can only move from the outer levels inward.(no content)In Clean Architecture, layering is about dependency management, and the dependency rule is the real way of achieving layers, with layers being the result of the dependency rule rather than the other way around.

## Tools and Technologies

**Static Code Analysis Tools**

Static code analysis tools are an option for architecture validation, with one library used in industry being dependency-cruiser, which helps define the rules on which dependencies operate in a system and enables visualization of them.(no content)This tool scans the imports in system files and then compares them with defined or predefined rules.

**Design Rule Specification**

Tools like Lattix LDM permit succinct definition of design rules to specify allowable dependencies and can be used to demonstrate how design rules can enforce architectural patterns such as layering and componentization.

**Benefits of Real-Time Validation**

Developers get real-time design feedback in the editor so they can immediately stop introducing architectural flaws.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: "git hooks pre-commit code quality automation framework 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Effortless Code Quality: The Ultimate Pre-Commit Hooks Guide for 2025","url":"https://gatlenculp.medium.com/effortless-code-quality-the-ultimate-pre-commit-hooks-guide-for-2025-57ca501d9835"},{"title":"Git Hooks for Automated Code Quality Checks Guide 2025 - DEV Community","url":"https://dev.to/arasosman/git-hooks-for-automated-code-quality-checks-guide-2025-372f"},{"title":"Automating Code Quality Control with Pre-commit Hooks | by Fedor GNETKOV | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@gnetkov/automating-code-quality-control-with-pre-commit-hooks-fdbc1ec5cfea"},{"title":"pre-commit","url":"https://pre-commit.com/"},{"title":"Pre-Commit & Git Hooks: Automate High Code Quality | Towards Data Science","url":"https://towardsdatascience.com/pre-commit-git-hooks-automate-high-code-quality-fbcbaa720e52/"},{"title":"Implementing pre-commit hooks to enforce code quality","url":"https://graphite.com/guides/implementing-pre-commit-hooks-to-enforce-code-quality"},{"title":"Ruff 0.6 Pre-Commit: Git Hooks Configuration 2025","url":"https://johal.in/ruff-0-6-pre-commit-git-hooks-configuration-2025/"},{"title":"How to Configure Git Hooks with Husky for Pre-Commit Verification","url":"https://jsdev.space/howto/git-hooks-husky/"},{"title":"The Comprehensive Guide to `pre-commit` · GitHub","url":"https://gist.github.com/MangaD/6a85ee73dd19c833270524269159ed6e"},{"title":"From pre-commit to Prek: The Evolution of Code Quality Automation | by Ivan Vialov | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@zwbf/from-pre-commit-to-prek-the-evolution-of-code-quality-automation-08f4bab00710"}]

I've successfully retrieved the search results for your query on git hooks, pre-commit frameworks, and code quality automation in 2025. Here's a summary of what I found:

## Key Findings

Pre-commit is a framework for managing and automating pre-commit hooks, which are scripts that run automatically before a commit is finalized in a version control system like Git.

### How Pre-Commit Works

Git hooks are scripts that run automatically at some stage in the git-lifecycle, with pre-commit hooks most commonly used, running before a commit goes through.(no content)These hooks are designed to check the code for issues and ensure that only high-quality code is committed to repository.

### Key Capabilities

Pre-commit hooks automatically run checks like code formatting, linting, type checking, and running tests before committing changes.(no content)While CI/CD pipelines might take minutes to run, pre-commit hooks provide instant feedback right when you commit.

### 2025 Developments

One notable advancement is Ruff 0.6 integrated with pre-commit git hooks has become the gold standard for enforcing code quality at the source.(no content)Ruff 0.6 pre-commit git hooks deliver blazing speed, comprehensive rules, and seamless integration with 67x faster linting, 92% autofix, zero-cost scaling.

Additionally, Prek is a complete reimplementation of pre-commit in Rust offering the same idea and configurations but with enhanced performance.

### Configuration

The configuration for Pre-commit is done in the .pre-commit-config.yaml file, which is used by the Pre-commit framework to define a set of hooks that should run automatically before making a Git commit.

Based on the search results, here's comprehensive information about Architecture Decision Records (ADRs), validation, tools, and governance:

## What are ADRs?

An architecture decision record (ADR) is a document that captures an important architecture decision made along with its context and consequences.(no content)An architecture decision (AD) is a software design choice that addresses a significant requirement.

## ADR Validation and Governance

The process involves validating if a change in a software component conforms to agreed decisions. As a good practice, each software change should go through peer reviews and require at least one approval. During the code review, a code reviewer might find changes that violate one or more ADRs and asks the author to update the code with a link to the ADR.(no content)By integrating ADRs into their routine, Agile teams benefit from a framework that not only supports the rapid, iterative pace of Agile development, but also strengthens knowledge management and project governance.

## Tools and Governance Solutions

Several tools and platforms support ADR management:

- MkDocs can be used for documentation-as-code, helping keep ADRs revised regularly.
- SAP LeanIX allows storing all architecture decision records in one centralized location, ensuring every stakeholder has access to a single source of truth and improving alignment and agility in decision-making.
- Free templates and guides for ADR are available on platforms like Miro and GitHub.

## Governance Framework Approaches

The ADR framework is designed to guide stakeholders through the process of making informed architectural decisions, determining the scope of the decision and identifying the appropriate decision-making level, which could be at the team or project level, programme level, departmental level, or cross-department level.

Your rules. JavaScript, TypeScript, CoffeeScript. ES6, CommonJS, AMD.","url":"https://github.com/sverweij/dependency-cruiser"},{"title":"GitHub - javierbrea/eslint-plugin-boundaries: Eslint plugin checking architecture boundaries between elements","url":"https://github.com/javierbrea/eslint-plugin-boundaries"},{"title":"6 Tools for Enforcing Good Web Architecture","url":"https://jmulholland.com/architecture-tools/"},{"title":"dependency-cruiser - npm","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/dependency-cruiser"},{"title":"eslint-plugin-boundaries - npm","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-boundaries"},{"title":"Dependency Cruiser: Restrict Imports in JavaScript","url":"https://spin.atomicobject.com/dependency-cruiser-imports/"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about these three tools for architecture enforcement:

## Key Tools and Their Purposes

**Dependency-Cruiser**: A tool to enforce rules about dependencies.(no content)Dependency-cruiser has advanced visualization capabilities built-in. It supports layered architecture patterns and allows you to enforce which imports are allowed, enabling you to create an architecture fitness function that ensures your code continues to adhere to the initial design.

**Layered Architecture**: On the backend, you have design patterns like layered architecture, hexagonal (or ports and adapters) architecture. This is an architectural pattern that dependency-cruiser can help enforce.

**ESLint Plugin Architecture Tools**: There are several ESLint plugins for enforcing architecture:
- eslint-plugin-dependency-cruiser runs Dependency Cruiser as an ESLint rule and reports import rule violations.
- ESLint Plugin Boundaries is an ESLint plugin that helps you maintain clean architecture by enforcing boundaries between different parts of your codebase, with instant feedback when boundaries are violated.

## How They Compare

Dependency-cruiser usually provides feedback after a failed CI build, whereas eslint aids developers instantly, with visualization provided by dependency-cruiser being a unique feature absent in a typical linter.(no content)A combination of both tools can attain a developer experience that aligns with your team's needs.

Links: [{"title":"Understanding quality gates | SonarQube Cloud | Sonar Documentation","url":"https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-cloud/standards/managing-quality-gates/introduction-to-quality-gates"},{"title":"Quality gates | SonarQube Server 10.5 | Sonar Documentation","url":"https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-server/10.5/user-guide/quality-gates"},{"title":"Quality gates | SonarQube Server 10.8 | Sonar Documentation","url":"https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-server/10.8/instance-administration/analysis-functions/quality-gates"},{"title":"Understanding quality gates | SonarQube Server | Sonar Documentation","url":"https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-server/quality-standards-administration/managing-quality-gates/introduction-to-quality-gates"},{"title":"SonarQube in 2025: The Ultimate Guide to Code Quality, CI/CD Integration & Alerting | by GAIDI | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@lamjed.gaidi070/sonarqube-in-2025-the-ultimate-guide-to-code-quality-ci-cd-integration-alerting-43e96018d36f"},{"title":"Code Duplication, Quality Gate and Default branch - SonarQube Server / Community Build - Sonar Community","url":"https://community.sonarsource.com/t/code-duplication-quality-gate-and-default-branch/26999"},{"title":"Integrating Quality Gates into Your CI/CD Pipeline: SonarQube Setup Guide | Sonar","url":"https://www.sonarsource.com/learn/integrating-quality-gates-ci-cd-pipeline/"},{"title":"Quality gates | SonarQube Server 9.9","url":"https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-server/9.9/user-guide/quality-gates"},{"title":"Quality gates | SonarQube Server 10.6 | Sonar Documentation","url":"https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-server/10.6/user-guide/quality-gates"},{"title":"Managing your project's quality gate | SonarQube Server | Sonar Documentation","url":"https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-server/latest/project-administration/changing-quality-gate-and-fudge-factor/#:~:text=Select Project Settings > General Settings,and coverage on small changes."}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about SonarQube code quality gates and duplication detection integration:

## Quality Gates Overview

SonarQube Cloud quality gates use sets of conditions to measure checks against your code during analysis.(no content)A quality gate consists of a set of conditions against which the code is measured during analysis.

## Duplication Detection in Quality Gates

SonarQube provides statistics on duplicated lines and blocks.(no content)The percentage of duplicated lines of code is above the set threshold is one of the conditions that can cause a quality gate to fail. The standard threshold for duplication is quite strict: Duplication in the new code is less than or equal to 3.0%.

## Configurable Duplication Settings

The duplication and test coverage conditions are configurable to your specifications. The other conditions are locked and cannot be edited if you wish to remain compliant with Clean as You Code.

## CI/CD Integration

Integrating quality gates into your CI/CD pipelines ensures these checks are performed automatically and continuously.(no content)When integrated into your CI/CD pipeline, SonarQube becomes a gatekeeper that automatically blocks bad code before it reaches production.

## Fudge Factor for Small Changes

The quality gate fudge factor refers to a mechanism where conditions on duplication and coverage are ignored until the number of new lines is at least 20. This is used to avoid overly strict enforcement when dealing with small changes, as minor issues might disproportionately impact the overall quality gate status.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.text:
Repository: aws/aws-toolkit-vscode
Path: .github/workflows/filterDuplicates.js
URL: https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/blob/master/.github/workflows/filterDuplicates.js
License: Apache-2.0

Snippets:
--- Snippet 1 (Line 1) ---
/**
 * Filters the report produced by jscpd to only include clones that involve changes from the given git diff.
 * If the filtered report is non-empty, i.e. there exists a clone in the changes,
 * the program exits with an error and logs the filtered report to console.
 *
 * Usage:
 *      node filterDuplicates.js run [path_to_git_diff] [path_to_jscpd_report] [commit_hash] [repo_name]
 *
 * Tests:
 *      node filterDuplicates.js test
 */



--- Snippet 2 (Line 101) ---
async function run() {
    const rawDiffPath = process.argv[3]
    const jscpdReportPath = process.argv[4]
    const commitHash = process.argv[5]
    const repoName = process.argv[6]
    const changes = await parseDiff(rawDiffPath)
    const jscpdReport = JSON.parse(await fs.readFile(jscpdReportPath, 'utf8'))
    const filteredDuplicates = filterDuplicates(jscpdReport, changes)

toolUseResult.text:
Repository: aws/aws-toolkit-vscode
Path: .github/workflows/filterDuplicates.js
URL: https://github.com/aws/aws-toolkit-vscode/blob/master/.github/workflows/filterDuplicates.js
License: Apache-2.0

Snippets:
--- Snippet 1 (Line 1) ---
/**
 * Filters the report produced by jscpd to only include clones that involve changes from the given git diff.
 * If the filtered report is non-empty, i.e. there exists a clone in the changes,
 * the program exits with an error and logs the filtered report to console.
 *
 * Usage:
 *      node filterDuplicates.js run [path_to_git_diff] [path_to_jscpd_report] [commit_hash] [repo_name]
 *
 * Tests:
 *      node filterDuplicates.js test
 */



--- Snippet 2 (Line 101) ---
async function run() {
    const rawDiffPath = process.argv[3]
    const jscpdReportPath = process.argv[4]
    const commitHash = process.argv[5]
    const repoName = process.argv[6]
    const changes = await parseDiff(rawDiffPath)
    const jscpdReport = JSON.parse(await fs.readFile(jscpdReportPath, 'utf8'))
    const filteredDuplicates = filterDuplicates(jscpdReport, changes)

Links: [{"title":"Enforcing API Correctness: Automated Contract Testing with OpenAPI and Dredd - DEV Community","url":"https://dev.to/r3d_cr0wn/enforcing-api-correctness-automated-contract-testing-with-openapi-and-dredd-2212"},{"title":"Dredd — HTTP API Testing Framework — Dredd latest documentation","url":"https://dredd.org/"},{"title":"Automated API Testing with Dredd: Ensuring Accurate API Documentation - Commencis","url":"https://www.commencis.com/thoughts/automated-api-testing-with-dredd-ensuring-accurate-api-documentation/"},{"title":"Dredd","url":"https://www.checkops.com/dredd/"},{"title":"GitHub - apiaryio/dredd: Language-agnostic HTTP API Testing Tool","url":"https://github.com/apiaryio/dredd"},{"title":"How It Works — Dredd latest documentation","url":"https://dredd.org/en/latest/how-it-works.html"},{"title":"How-To Guides — Dredd latest documentation","url":"https://dredd.org/en/latest/how-to-guides.html"},{"title":"Local API testing with Dredd | Apiary Help","url":"https://help.apiary.io/tools/automated-testing/testing-local/"},{"title":"An Introduction to API Based Documentation Automating - EvilTester.com","url":"https://www.eviltester.com/blog/eviltester/apis/openapi-tooling-validation/"},{"title":"Testing and Validation in OpenAPI | OpenAPI Specification","url":"https://openapispec.com/docs/testing-and-validation/"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Dredd API testing with OpenAPI validation and automation:

## What is Dredd?

Dredd is a command-line tool that validates your live API against your OpenAPI (or API Blueprint) specification.(no content)It is a language-agnostic command-line tool for validating API description document against backend implementation of the API.

## How It Works

Dredd sends real HTTP requests and checks responses, ensuring that if your API returns "price": "19.99" (a string), Dredd fails because the spec requires a number, and if POST /products returns 200 instead of 201, Dredd fails—status code mismatch.

## Validation Capabilities

To validate the structure Dredd uses JSON Schema inferred from the API description under test.(no content)Dredd supports API Blueprint, OpenAPI 2 (formerly known as Swagger), and OpenAPI 3 (experimental, contributions welcome!).

## Automation & CI/CD Integration

Dredd integrates seamlessly with popular CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions, Jenkins, and GitLab CI/CD.(no content)By adding Dredd to a pipeline, teams can continuously validate their API against its documentation as part of every build or deployment process.

## Customization

With support for hook files, Dredd also allows advanced customization, enabling developers to handle tasks such as authentication, data setup, or cleanup before and after tests.

Web search results for query: "nx eslint-plugin-nx module boundaries architecture linting"

Links: [{"title":"Enforce Module Boundaries | Nx","url":"https://nx.dev/docs/features/enforce-module-boundaries"},{"title":"@nx/eslint-plugin | Nx","url":"https://nx.dev/nx-api/eslint-plugin"},{"title":"Enforce Module Boundaries ESLint Rule | Nx","url":"https://nx.dev/docs/technologies/eslint/eslint-plugin/guides/enforce-module-boundaries"},{"title":"Enforcing Boundaries with ESLint and Nx - delvestack","url":"https://delvestack.com/post/enforcing-boundaries-with-eslint-and-nx/"},{"title":"nx/eslint-plugin","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@nx/eslint-plugin"},{"title":"Taming Code Organization with Module Boundaries in Nx | Nx Blog","url":"https://nx.dev/blog/mastering-the-project-boundaries-in-nx"},{"title":"Nx Library Tagging & ESLint Rules for Architecture Boundaries · GitHub","url":"https://gist.github.com/bphkns/a3f65a1535ebb79000503f08abec8d9e"},{"title":"@nrwl/eslint-plugin-nx - npm","url":"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@nrwl/eslint-plugin-nx"},{"title":"Enforce Boundaries | Marmicode Cookbook","url":"https://cookbook.marmicode.io/nx/boundaries"},{"title":"@nx/eslint - Executors | Nx","url":"https://nx.dev/docs/technologies/eslint/executors"}]

I found comprehensive information about Nx's eslint-plugin-nx and module boundaries architecture linting. Here's what I discovered:

## Overview

The eslint-plugin package is an ESLint plugin that contains a collection of recommended ESLint rule configurations which you can extend from in your own ESLint configs, as well as an Nx-specific lint rule called enforce-module-boundaries.

## Key Features

Nx provides powerful mechanisms to enforce architectural boundaries and ensure projects can only depend on each other according to your organization's rules.(no content)The @nx/enforce-module-boundaries ESLint rule enables you to define strict rules for accessing resources between different projects in the repository. Enforcing strict boundaries helps to prevent unplanned cross-dependencies.

## How It Works

You can declaratively define constraints using project tags and enforce them automatically.(no content)For JavaScript/TypeScript projects, enforce boundaries on code imports using the @nx/enforce-module-boundaries ESLint rule. This checks TypeScript imports and package.json dependencies during linting.

## Configuration

The depConstraints option of the @nx/enforce-module-boundaries rule allows you to enforce the boundaries you have defined for your workspace. The rule supports defining constraints based on project tags, allowing you to specify which projects can depend on which other projects based on their designated tags.

## Note on Package Names

@nrwl/eslint-plugin-nx will no longer be published in the future. The current package is `@nx/eslint-plugin`, which is the maintained version.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.text:
Perfect. Now I have comprehensive research on all four areas. Let me compile the findings into a detailed report.

## Code Quality Automation Research Report

I've conducted a comprehensive research on code quality automation tools for duplication detection, API validation, documentation, and architecture consistency. Here's what I found:

---

### 1. CODE DUPLICATION DETECTION

#### Leading Tools

**JSCPD (Copy/Paste Detector)**
- **Strength**: 150+ programming language support; uses Rabin-Karp algorithm
- **Integration**: NPM package with multiple reporter formats (JSON, XML, HTML, Markdown)
- **Reporting**: HTML reports, SARIF format (for integration with GitHub), markdown output
- **Git Integration**: Can be used in pre-commit hooks; ignores comments with `jscpd:ignore-start/end`
- **Configuration**: `.jscpd.json` for project-specific settings
- **References**: [JSCPD GitHub](https://github.com/kucherenko/jscpd), [NPM Package](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jscpd)

**PMD CPD (Copy/Paste Detector from PMD)**
- **Strength**: 31 language support; produces comprehensive results; faster for Java-focused projects
- **Architecture**: Java-based static analysis
- **Algorithms**: Also uses Rabin-Karp algorithm
- **Use Case**: Often used in production as backup when SonarQube doesn't support specific languages
- **References**: [PMD GitHub](https://github.com/pmd/pmd), [PMD CPD Documentation](https://pmd.github.io/pmd/pmd_userdocs_cpd.html)

**Simian**
- **Strength**: IntelliJ plugin support; supports 9 languages (Java, C#, C, C++, Ruby, Objective-C, Groovy, Swift)
- **Note**: Less commonly used in automation compared to JSCPD/PMD
- **References**: [Best Duplicate Code Checker Tools](https://www.codeant.ai/blogs/best-duplicate-code-checker-tools)

#### Integration with Quality Gates

**SonarQube Quality Gates**
- Standard duplication threshold: ≤3.0% duplicated lines in new code
- Configurable conditions with "fudge factor" (ignores small changes <20 lines)
- CI/CD integration prevents bad code from reaching production
- References: [SonarQube Quality Gates Documentation](https://docs.sonarsource.com/sonarqube-cloud/standards/managing-quality-gates/introduction-to-quality-gates)

---

### 2. API CONTRACT VALIDATION

#### Primary Approaches

**Pact (Consumer-Driven Contract Testing)**
- **Model**: Consumer tests generate contract files published to Pact Broker
- **Integration**: Provider CI pipeline fetches contracts to verify against code
- **Strength**: Validates actual behavior matches documented contracts
- **2025 Updates**: PactFlow AI generates Pact tests from OpenAPI descriptions
- **References**: [Pact Documentation](https://docs.pact.io/), [PactFlow Blog](https://docs.pactflow.io/docs/bi-directional-contract-testing/contracts/oas/)

**Dredd (OpenAPI/API Blueprint Validator)**
- **Function**: Validates live API against OpenAPI specification with real HTTP requests
- **Validation**: Checks response structure, status codes, and JSON Schema compliance
- **CI/CD**: Integrates with GitHub Actions, Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD
- **Customization**: Hook files for authentication and data setup/cleanup
- **Strength**: Transforms static documentation into dynamic validation
- **References**: [Dredd Documentation](https://dredd.org/), [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/apiaryio/dredd)

**OpenAPI + Pact Combined**
- **Coverage**: OpenAPI ensures public API specification compliance; Pact validates internal consumer requirements
- **Limitation**: OpenAPI doesn't establish unique request-response relations (needed for flow validation)
- **References**: [Pact vs OpenAPI Comparison](https://www.speakeasy.com/blog/pact-vs-openapi)

---

### 3. DOCUMENTATION COMPLETENESS CHECKS

#### Automated Validation Tools

**pydocstyle (Python)**
- **Function**: Static analysis tool checking PEP 257 docstring conventions
- **Integration**: Pre-commit hook compatible
- **Scope**: Python-specific docstring validation
- **References**: [pydocstyle GitHub](https://github.com/PyCQA/pydocstyle)

**Doxygen**
- **Languages**: C++, C, Python, Java, PHP, C#, Objective-C, IDL, Fortran
- **Model**: Documentation generation with template support
- **Extensibility**: Cross-language coverage
- **References**: [Doxygen Documentation](https://www.doxygen.nl/)

**Sphinx**
- **Primary Use**: Python documentation generator
- **Feature**: Automatic API documentation generation
- **AST-Based**: Can extract docstring templates from code analysis
- **References**: [Sphinx Documentation](https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/tutorial/automatic-doc-generation.html)

#### AI-Powered Solutions

**Modern Platforms**: Swimm, Theneo, Apidog, DocuWriter.ai
- **Approach**: Analyze function signatures, variable names, code structure
- **Output**: Contextual docstrings and API documentation
- **Quality Metrics**: Evaluate Completeness, Helpfulness, Truthfulness
- **Integration**: Update docs automatically on commits

---

### 4. ARCHITECTURAL CONSISTENCY VALIDATION

#### Core Tools

**Dependency-Cruiser**
- **Primary Function**: Validate and visualize dependencies with custom rules
- **Languages**: JavaScript, TypeScript, CoffeeScript, ES6, CommonJS, AMD
- **Patterns**: Enforces layered architecture, hexagonal architecture
- **Visualization**: Built-in dependency graph visualization
- **Configuration**: Rule-based architecture fitness functions
- **References**: [Dependency-Cruiser GitHub](https://github.com/sverweij/dependency-cruiser), [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/dependency-cruiser), [Blog Post](https://xebia.com/blog/taking-frontend-architecture-serious-with-dependency-cruiser/)

**ESLint Plugin Boundaries**
- **Function**: ESLint plugin enforcing architecture boundaries between code elements
- **Integration**: Real-time feedback in editor
- **Comparison**: Dependency-Cruiser provides visualization; ESLint provides immediate feedback
- **Synergy**: Both tools together create comprehensive developer experience
- **References**: [ESLint Plugin Boundaries GitHub](https://github.com/javierbrea/eslint-plugin-boundaries)

**@nx/eslint-plugin (Nx Framework)**
- **Rule**: @nx/enforce-module-boundaries ESLint rule
- **Scope**: Monorepo architecture enforcement
- **Model**: Tag-based constraint definition
- **Features**: Declarative constraints on project dependencies
- **Configuration**: depConstraints option with tag-based rules
- **References**: [Nx Module Boundaries Documentation](https://nx.dev/docs/features/enforce-module-boundaries), [Enforce Module Boundaries Guide](https://nx.dev/docs/technologies/eslint/eslint-plugin/guides/enforce-module-boundaries)

**Visual Studio Layer Diagrams**
- **Function**: Live dependency validation during development
- **Scope**: Validates source code against layer model
- **Support**: Custom validation extensions
- **Note**: Windows/.NET focused solution
- **References**: [Live Architecture Validation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/modeling/add-custom-architecture-validation-to-layer-diagrams)

#### Dependency Rule in Clean Architecture

The Dependency Rule enforces that source code dependencies point inward only—critical for maintaining architectural integrity. Layering emerges as a consequence of properly enforcing the dependency rule.

---

### 5. ARCHITECTURE DECISION RECORDS (ADR) VALIDATION

#### Governance Approach

**ADR Documentation Standards**
- **Purpose**: Captures important architecture decisions with context and consequences
- **Integration**: Peer reviews validate code changes against documented decisions
- **Enforcement**: Code reviewers check for ADR violations during review
- **Tools**: MkDocs for documentation-as-code; LeanIX for centralized ADR storage
- **References**: [ADR GitHub](https://github.com/joelparkerhenderson/architecture-decision-record), [ADR.github.io](https://adr.github.io/), [AWS Guidance](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/prescriptive-guidance/latest/architectural-decision-records/adr-process.html)

---

### 6. GIT HOOKS & PRE-COMMIT AUTOMATION

#### Pre-commit Framework

**Pre-commit** (Language-Agnostic)
- **Configuration**: `.pre-commit-config.yaml` file
- **Execution**: Automatic checks before git commit
- **Speed**: Instant feedback vs. multi-minute CI/CD pipelines
- **Tools**: Can chain JSCPD, linting, type-checking, testing
- **References**: [Pre-commit.com](https://pre-commit.com/), [Medium Guide 2025](https://gatlenculp.medium.com/effortless-code-quality-the-ultimate-pre-commit-hooks-guide-for-2025-57ca501d9835)

**Ruff 0.6 Integration**
- **Speed**: 67x faster linting
- **Autofix**: 92% autofix rate
- **Model**: Becoming gold standard for Python pre-commit hooks
- **References**: [Ruff Pre-Commit Configuration 2025](https://johal.in/ruff-0-6-pre-commit-git-hooks-configuration-2025/)

**Prek** (Rust Reimplementation)
- **Purpose**: Drop-in replacement for pre-commit in Rust
- **Advantage**: Enhanced performance while maintaining compatibility

---

### 7. INTEGRATED QUALITY GATE SYSTEMS

#### Comprehensive Solutions

**SonarQube Quality Gates** (with all features)
- **Duplication Checks**: ≤3.0% threshold for new code
- **Integration**: CI/CD blockade mechanism
- **Configuration**: Customizable conditions
- **Fudge Factor**: Small changes (≤20 lines) exempt from strict enforcement
- **References**: [SonarQube Integration Guide](https://www.sonarsource.com/learn/integrating-quality-gates-ci-cd-pipeline/)

---

### 8. ACTIONABLE REPORTS & FIX SUGGESTIONS

#### Output Formats

- **JSCPD**: HTML reports with visual duplication highlighting; SARIF format for GitHub integration
- **Dredd**: Detailed response mismatch reports with expected vs. actual values
- **Dependency-Cruiser**: Visual diagrams showing violation paths; rule-based recommendations
- **ESLint Plugins**: Real-time inline suggestions in editor; auto-fix capabilities
- **SonarQube**: Detailed metrics dashboards with trend analysis and fix priority ranking

---

### Key Recommendations for Your Use Case

1. **Lightweight & Automated**: Start with pre-commit framework + JSCPD for duplication + Dependency-Cruiser for architecture
2. **API Validation**: Dredd for OpenAPI specs + Pact for contract testing
3. **Documentation**: pydocstyle (Python) or integrate with Doxygen/Sphinx for cross-language support
4. **Architecture**: Combine Dependency-Cruiser (visualization) with ESLint plugins (real-time feedback)
5. **Git Hooks**: Use pre-commit framework with Ruff (Python) or equivalent tools for your stack
6. **Quality Gates**: Integrate into CI/CD with SonarQube or lightweight custom gates per tool
